question: On which of the following the definition of a small-scale industry is based?
option1: The market outreach of a unit
option2: The size of the sales of a unit
option3: The fact whether the products manufactured fall in a list drawn up by the Ministry of Industry
option4: The value of the plant and machinery investment in a unit
answer: The value of the plant and machinery investment in a unit
explanation: The definition of a small-scale industry is based on the value of the plant and machinery investment in a unit. Small scale industries (SSI) are those industries in which manufacturing, providing services, productions are done on a small scale or micro scale. These industries do a one-time investment in machinery, plants, and industries which could be on an ownership basis, hire purchase or lease basis.
